text:
(1)
Spyuten Duyvil Road (foreground, not seen), at the foot of Spyuten Duyvil Hill, showing the railroad cut and tracks of the New York Central Railroad. The view is eastward from a narrow foot bridge over the tracks.

P. L. Sperr

(2)
Viewing westward from the other end of the railroad cut. Note, between the cliffs, the Henry Hudson Bridge.

P. L. Sperr

text:

Broadway, north from but not including Lake View Place, showing the site (where shacks are seen, right) of the Henry Hudson Parkway Bridge which was thrown across Broadway later in the year.

April 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, as seen from the west side of the street.

April 23, 1935.

Broadway, at the S.W. corner of West 253rd Street, showing steam shovels breaking the ground for the construction of the Henry Hudson Parkway bridge which was thrown across Broadway.

April 30, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

Henry Hudson Bridge: A set of 2 views of the concrete base under construction at the edge of Inwood Hill Park, Manhattan. Slightly north of same is the Railroad Bridge that carries the New York Central tracks across the Harlem River. In the right background is visible the New Jersey Shore.

September 31, 1935.
View 2:-September 16, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
(Not a dry mount item).
title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge - [Inwood Hill Park.]

text:
Henry Hudson Memorial Bridge: A view southeastward of same while under construction. Photographers vantage point is in the Spuyten Duyvil section of the Bronx. On the far side of the Harlem River is Inwood Hill Park, Manhattan.

1936.

W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers project.
(Not a dry mount item).
title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Memorial Bridge.

text:
Henry Hudson Memorial Bridge: A view southwestward of this new structure that will carry an extension of Riverside Drive across to the Borough of the Bronx. This new highway will also bear the name, Henry Hudson. Photographers vantage point is in the Spuyten Duyvil section of the Bronx and he shows Inwood Hill Park on the far side of the Harlem River.

1936.

W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.
{not a dry mount item}.
title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Memorial Bridge - [Inwood Hill Park.]

original_title: Manhattan: Henry Hudson Parkway - Dyckman Street
text:
Henry Hudson Parkway: An aerial view from a point, slightly south of Dyckman Street (shown in foreground with bridges crossing same) showing the Parkway, a feature of the West Side Improvement Project progressing northward through Inwood Hill Park and across the Henry Hudson Bridge over the Harlem River to the Spuyten Duyvil section of the Bronx. Note the New York Central Railroad tracks which more or less parallel this roadway in conjunction with the North (Hudson) River bank. The U shaped basin of the Harlem River, shown at the right top formed by the peninsula projecting southward will soon disappear, a ship canal is now under construction that will bisect the latter and the basin filled in. For an account of same, see the New York Times of April 27, 1927. This photograph appeared in a brochure published by the Department of Parks on October 12, 1937 and issued at the public ceremonies attending the opening.

1937.

Gift of Department of Parks.

Henry Hudson Bridge over the Harlem River, seen from the Hudson River, In the foreground is the New York Central Railroad Bridge.

P. L. Sperr

1937
Views 1,2
title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge - [Harlem River.]

text:
Henry Hudson Bridge over the Harlem River, seen from the Hudson River, In the foreground is the New York Central Railroad Bridge.

P. L. Sperr

1937
Views 1,2
title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge - [Harlem River.]

text:

Henry Hudson Bridge: A view southwestward from Spuyten Duyvil Hill, Bronx. The bridge spans the Harlem River linking the Spuyten Duyvil section of the Bronx with Inwood Hill Park, Manhattan.
May 25, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, a more distant view.
May 25, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A view southward toward Manhattan.
May 25, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

text:
(1)
Henry Hudson Bridge: A view east from Independence
Avenue, in the Spuyten Duyvil section of the Bronx.
May 25, 1937
P. L. Sperr
(2) and (3)
Two views, looking westward on the Harlem River, of the bridge, Spuyten Duyvil Hill, the Bronx, and the New Jersey shore on the west bank of the Hudson River. The apartment house is the Villa Victoria, and below the hill is visible the Spuyten Duyvil station of the New York Central Railroad.
August 21, 1939
P. L. Sperr
title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge.

Harlem River - 218th Street (West) - Spuyten Duyvil.
Harlem River - 218th Street (West) - Spuyten Duyvil.

text:
(1) Henry Hudson Bridge, spanning the Harlem River, between Inwood Hill Park, Manhattan and Spuyten Duyvil Hill, the Bronx. The view is west toward the palisades of New Jersey and shows, also, the New York Central Railroad bridge (left). August 2, 1939

P. L. Sperr

(2) The Henry Hudson Bridge and New York Central Railroad bridge (open), seen from Spuyten Duyvil Hill, the Bronx. In the background is the shore of New Jersey. July 15, 1939

P. L. Sperr

(3) Viewing northeastward from the Hudson River across the New York Central Railroad and Henry Hudson Bridge, toward Spuyten Duyvil. August 2, 1939

P. L. Sperr
title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge - [View of the bridge over Harlem River, linking Spuyten Duyvil Hill, Bronx with Inwood Hill Park, Manhattan.]
